text.section: The Commissioner may conduct an on-site examination of a licensee or authorized delegate with not less than 7 business days prior notice.
With good cause, the Commissioner may conduct an on-site examination of a licensee or authorized delegate with no prior notice.

The licensee shall pay all reasonably incurred costs of an examination conducted under this section, including a per-day fee set by the Commissioner for each of the Commissioner's employees engaged in the examination.
The on-site examination may be conducted in conjunction with an examination performed by a representative of a responsible supervisory agency of another state.

section.section: The Commissioner, in lieu of an on-site examination, may accept the examination report of a responsible supervisory agency of another state, or a report prepared by an independent accounting firm.
A report accepted under paragraph (1) of this subsection is considered for all purposes as an official report of the Commissioner.

text.section:
The Commissioner may:
Examine all books, accounts, and records the Commissioner determines are necessary to conduct a complete examination; and
Examine under oath any officer, director, or employee of the licensee, or any other individual who may provide information on behalf of the licensee.
